description.en: What is your country of birth?
Are you currently an exchange student in Mannheim?
Do you already have professional experience from working in a job (other than a student job)?
If yes: was this experience related to finance?
Have you ever worked with a statistics program like Stata or&nbspR?
Please consider all sources of current income from work, transfers from your parents, stipends etc.

label.en: What is approximately the amount of wealth you own

description.en: In cash (also on a debit account, sav­ings account etc.)
In assets, e.g. in stocks, bonds, mutual funds etc.
In other valuables (e.g. cars, durables, art etc.)

label.en: What is the amount of debt you owe
Do you currently own/use any of the following financial products?

description.en: An insurance contract (except mandatory health insurance)
A mobile phone payment app (e.g. Google pay, Apple pay etc.)
Crypto assets (e.g. Bitcoin) or ICOs (Initial Coin Offerings)

label.en: Do you do any of the following for yourself or your household?

description.en: Make a plan to manage your income and expenses
Keep a note of your spending
Keep money for bills separate from day-to-day spending money
Make a note of upcoming bills to make sure you  don't miss them
Use a banking app or money management tool to keep track of your outgoings
Arrange automatic payments for regular outgoings

Sometimes people find that their income does not quite cover their living expenses. 
					In the last 12 months, has this happened to you personally?
How would you rate your overall knowledge about financial matters compared with other adults?

label.en: Which of the following statements describes the main function of the stock market?
The stock market helps to predict stock earnings.

label.de: Der Aktienmarkt führt zu einer Preiserhöhung für Aktien.
label.en: The stock market results in an increase in the price of stocks.

label.de: Der Aktienmarkt bringt Aktienkäufer und -verkäufer zusammen.
label.en: The stock market brings people who want to buy stock together with those who want to sell stocks.
Which of the following statements is correct?
Once one invests in a mutual fund, one cannot withdraw the money in the first year.
Mutual funds can invest in several assets, for example invest in both stocks and bonds.
Mutual funds pay a guaranteed rate of return which depends on their past performance.

description.en:
Do you think that the following statement is true or false? 
					Buying a single company stock usually provides a safer return than a stock mutual fund.
Normally, which asset displays the highest fluctuations over time?
Considering a long time period (for example 20 years), which asset normal gives the highest av­er­age return
When an investor spreads his money among different assets, does the risk of losing money

Suppose you had 100 Euros in a sav­ings account and the interest rate was 2% per year. 
					After 5 years, how much do you think you would have in the account if you left the money to grow?

Imagine that the interest rate on your sav­ings account was 1% per year and inflation was 2% per year. 
					After 1 year, would you be able to buy more than, exactly the same as, or less than today with the money in this account?

Suppose you had 100 Euros in a sav­ings account and the interest rate is 20% per year and you never withdraw money or interest payments.  
					After 5 years, how much would you have on this account in total?

Suppose that in the year 2020, your income has doubled and prices of all goods have doubled too. 
					In 2020, how much will you be able to buy with your income?
If the interest rates fall, what happens to bond prices?

A bat and a ball cost $1.10 in total. The bat costs $1.00 more than the ball.
			How much does the ball cost?

If it takes 5 machines 5 minutes to make 5 widgets, 
			how long would it take 100 machines to make 100 widgets?

In a lake there is a patch of lily pads. Every day, the patch doubles in size. 
			If it takes 48 days for the patch to cover the entire lake, how long would it take
			for the patch to cover half of the lake?

label.en: How do you see yourself – how will­ing are you in general to take risks?

description.en: Not at all will­ing to take risks

label.en: How do you see yourself on a scale from ...

description.en: I am good at resisting temptation
I refuse things that are bad for me
I wish I had more self discipline (R)
Pleasure and fun sometimes keep me from getting work done (R)
I am able to work effectively towards long term goals
Sometimes I cant stop myself from doing something, even if I know it is wrong (R)
I often act without thinking through the alternatives (R)
I am impulsive and tend to buy things even when I can’t really afford them.
I set financial goals for the next 1–2 months for what I want to achieve with my money.

How well do the following statements describe your personality?
I see myself as someone who...

The next question deals with optimism.
Optimistis are people who look to the future with confidence and who mostly expect good things to happen. How would you describe yourself? How op­ti­mis­tic are you in general?

The next question is about pessimism.
Pessimists are people who are full of doubt when they look to the future and who mostly expect bad things to happen. How would you describe yourself? How pes­si­mis­tic are you in general?

label.de:
Zugang bleibt bestehen.  
							Daten können in weiteren Sitzungen geändert werden.
label.en:
Leave questionnaire open. 
							Data can be changed in later sessions.

label.de: Fragebogen ist abgeschlossen. Keine Änderungen möglich.
label.en: Questionnaire is finished. No more edits.
